Present location: BIBLIOTHECA ALEXANDRINA ANTIQUETIES MUSEUM [01/027] ALEXANDRIA BAAM
Name: Statuette of a Lady Playing Harp
Description: The statuette depicts a lady playing a triangular harp. She faces forward, carrying the harp on her right shoulder and stretching her left fingers to touch the strings. She wears Greek-style clothes that expose her right shoulder. Her garment looks tied from the middle but its fold dangles in the middle of the body and hangs down between the legs. Her head is decorated with a crown made of overlapping plants. The tufts of her combed hair appear from under the crown in the form of a circle surrounding her face. Her features can hardly be seen.
